long_description: An elegant kayak for both aspiring novices or experience paddlers on extended tours, the Eddyline Fathom Kayak with Skeg moves through ocean waters like it's a part of the natural environment. The Eddyline Fathom features a good amount of initial stability to build confidence for new paddlers on multiday excursions. Combination of hard chines mid-ship and a healthy amount of rocker provide high secondary stability, making leaned, carved turns and more advanced techniques easy. Co-extruded ABS laminate creates a hull that offers the looks and performance of a composite kayak with the durability of plastic. Plastic is shaped into a 2-layer sheet with durable interior and an abrasion- and UV-resistant exterior, and then it's thermoformed using very high temperatures and a vacuum. 2-layer plastic laminate offers incredible stiffness and a hard, glossy appearance that resists abrasion and impact; plus, because it's plastic, it can also be easily repaired. Full-volume front deck offers enough room for large paddlers, and the countoured thigh braces offer a secure fit for any size paddler. Sliding seat adjusts in relation to the thighbraces to enhance comfort. Low back deck makes it easy to execute a roll. Skeg is deployable in small increments to allow for fine-tuning in any condition in order to reduce weathercocking in crosswinds and increase tracking. The Eddyline Fathom features bulkheads, a recessed compass holder, and 3 day hatches with enough space to easily pack in overnight gear and then some.
short_description: An elegant kayak for both aspiring novices or experience paddlers on extended tours, the Eddyline Fathom Kayak with Skeg moves through ocean waters like it's a part of the natural environment.
